docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The Bush Administration today further eased restrictions on foreigners infected with the AIDS virus who want to attend conferences in the United States, but opponents of the restrictions said the move fell short of the changes needed.

headline.main: Visa Rules Eased for Foreigners With AIDS

docs.snippet: LEAD: The Bush Administration today further eased restrictions on foreigners infected with the AIDS virus who want to attend conferences in the United States, but opponents of the restrictions said the move fell short of the changes needed.

byline.original: By WARREN E. LEARY, Special to The New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Although most childhood ailments are minor, they are often sufficiently bothersome to prompt parents to try some form of drug treatment to relieve symptoms or foster a rapid recovery.
docs.snippet: LEAD: Although most childhood ailments are minor, they are often sufficiently bothersome to prompt parents to try some form of drug treatment to relieve symptoms or foster a rapid recovery.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: UNIVERSITY OF MICHIGAN SCHOOL OF PUBLIC HEALTH

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: An experimental drug treatment for sickle-cell disease may be the first to affect the disorder itself and not just the symptoms, researchers said today. They said promising results in preliminary human trials warranted larger trials.

headline.main: DRUG IS PROMISING IN SICKLE-CELL TEST

docs.snippet: LEAD: An experimental drug treatment for sickle-cell disease may be the first to affect the disorder itself and not just the symptoms, researchers said today. They said promising results in preliminary human trials warranted larger trials.

byline.original: By WARREN E. LEARY, Special to The New York Times
